meanings.definition: The process of depositing sediment or soil in a body of water, causing it to become shallower.
meanings.sent1: Silting can make rivers less deep over time.
meanings.sent2: The silting of the lake has made it difficult for boats to navigate.
meanings.sent3: The fish complained about the silting in the pond, saying they needed more space to swim.
meanings.sent4: The silting of the ocean floor painted a picture of gradual change over centuries.
meanings.sent5: Silting in the bay created a sandy beach where once there was only water.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming filled or blocked with sediment or soil.
meanings.sent1: After heavy rain, the silting of the drainage pipes caused flooding in the streets.
meanings.sent2: The silting of the dam reduced its capacity to hold water.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome joked that he was experiencing silting in his hat from the dirt blowing around.
meanings.sent4: The old well showed signs of silting, as the mud slowly filled it up.
meanings.sent5: Silting in the flower pot made it challenging for the roots to grow deeper.
